data.title: Cairo vs Kabul Climate & Distance Between
data.text:
The distance between Cairo, Egypt and Kabul, Afghanistan is approximately 3,565 km or 2,215 mi.

To reach Cairo in this distance one would set out from Kabul bearing 272.8° or W and follow the great circles arc to approach Cairo bearing 252&deg or WSW .

Cairo has a subtropical hot desert climate (BWh) whereas Kabul has a mid-latitude cool steppe climate (BSk).

Cairo is in or near the subtropical desert biome whereas Kabul is in or near the cool temperate steppe biome.

The annual average temperature is 9.4 °C (16.9°F) warmer.

Average monthly temperatures vary by 13.3 °C (23.9°F) less in Cairo. The continentality subtype is truly oceanic as opposed to subcontinental.

Total annual precipitation averages 286 mm (11.3 in) less which is equivalent to 286 l/m² (7.02 US gal/ft²) or 2,860,000 l/ha (305,753 US gal/ac) less. About 0 as much.

There are 366 more hours of sunlight per year in Cairo. In whichever way circa 1h 00' more per day or about 1 1/8 as many.

The altitude of the sun at midday is overall 4.5° higher in Cairo than in Kabul.

Relative humidity levels are 4.2% higher.

The mean dew point temperature is 10.1°C (18.3°F) higher.

Climate Comparison Table

The table shows values for Cairo relative to Kabul. You can also view this comparison the other way around from the perspective of Kabul vs Cairo.
